H0.text: In Greek mythology, what was the name of the nymphs who tended the garden from where Heracles stole golden apples. Atlantia

H1.text: In Greek mythology, what was the name of the nymphs who tended the garden from where Heracles stole golden apples. Chryseis

H2.text: In Greek mythology, what was the name of the nymphs who tended the garden from where Heracles stole golden apples. Dryad

H3.text: In Greek mythology, what was the name of the nymphs who tended the garden from where Heracles stole golden apples. Hespera

A4.text: Apollonius of Rhodes gives the number of three with their names as Aigle, Erytheis, and Hespere (or Hespera).

A5.text: Hespere became a poplar and Eretheis an elm, and Aegle a willow's sacred trunk ...
